description: Canonical semantic frame for cultural events (festivals, exhibitions, premieres, ceremonies, etc.) used by Abstract Wiki Architect.

frame_type.description: Canonical frame type name. Normalization code accepts several aliases, but JSON authored against this schema should prefer 'event.cultural'.

main_event.description: The primary cultural event this frame describes (festival, exhibition, ceremony, premiere, etc.). This is typically the article subject.

event_kind.description: High-level kind of cultural event, e.g. 'festival', 'film_festival', 'music_festival', 'exhibition', 'ceremony', 'premiere', 'awards_ceremony'.

location.description: Primary location (city, venue, region) where the cultural event takes place.

time_span.description: Approximate temporal span of the event (a specific date or a multi-day / multi-week period).

organizers.description: Organizations or bodies responsible for organizing or hosting the event.

participants.description: Key participants associated with the event (artists, groups, delegations, juries). This list is intended to capture salient participants rather than an exhaustive roster.

edition_number.description: Ordinal number of this edition, if the event is recurring (e.g. 75 for the '75th Venice International Film Festival').

recurring.description: Whether the cultural event is part of a recurring series (annual festival, biennale, etc.).

series_entity.description: If the event is one edition within a larger series, this is the entity representing the overall series (e.g. 'Cannes Film Festival').

headline_audience_size.description: Approximate audience size or attendance count for the event (e.g. total spectators, visitors).

headline_audience_year.description: Reference year for the headline audience size, if it differs from the event year (e.g. multi-year averages).

domain_labels.description: Lexical labels for the cultural domain(s) involved, e.g. 'film', 'music', 'theatre', 'art', 'literature'.

attributes.description: Free-form attribute bag for extensibility (e.g. award_categories, competition_sections, ticketing_info). Keys should be snake_case strings.

Entity.description: Lightweight entity reference used inside frames. It mirrors semantics.common.entity_base.Entity.

id.description: Stable identifier, typically a Wikidata QID such as 'Q42', or another project-specific ID.

name.description: Canonical surface label for the entity in the working language.

gender.description: Optional gender code for human entities, e.g. 'male', 'female', 'unknown'.

human.description: Whether this entity is a human individual.

entity_type.description: Optional coarse type hint such as 'organization', 'person', 'place', 'event'.

lemmas.description: Optional list of lemma strings associated with the entity, e.g. profession, role, or domain lemmas.

features.description: Arbitrary feature dictionary (e.g. grammatical, semantic, or domain-specific flags).

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata attached to the entity.

TimeSpan.description: Coarse time span representation as used in semantics.common.entity_base.TimeSpan.

approximate.description: Whether the dates are approximate or inferred.

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata related to the time span.
